content.description: This route cruises over some fun and unique rock features. Starts on the southwest corner of Split Rock to the pointy little pinnacle of the chimney. After wrapping up its cruxiness, the step-over is heady but easier. From here, the bolt line wanders up to Fossilmax's anchors.
content.protection: 11 bolts as designed plus a sling for the top of the chimney (we clipped an extra draw to the Chim-Chiminey anchor below which made the step over move ridiculously well protected). Ends at the shared anchor with other west face of Split Rock routes.
content.location:
Southwest side of Split Rock, downhill of the split chimney. Easily seen from the trail.

Rap off at the end. The route is too long to lower a leader with a 60 meter rope. I liked belaying my second from the top.

content.description:
This route is the left-hand line on the west side of Split Rock, with 8 bolts.

Like Fossilmax, it is well-protected and a good intro to slab climbing.

The crux comes early.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a rusty but sturdy anchor with rap chains.
content.location: From the namesake split on the west side the rock, this is the leftmost of the pair of bolted routes on this section. The main trail to the Sugarloaf passes right by it. Rap off the anchor.

content.description: Fossilmax is the right hand bolt line on the west side of split rock, immediately left of the chimney.
content.protection: 9 bolts to a single bolted anchor (with rap chains) shared with TriTip.
content.location: West side of Split Rock, immediate left of the split. Rap off the anchors top when done.

content.description: The chimney that gives Split Rock its name.
content.protection: Three bolts, and a bolted anchor with chains at the top. The first bolt is fairly high, you wouldn't want to deck there.
content.location: Inside the split of Split Rock.

content.description: Named for the bulbous feature it ascends on the top of Split Rock. A few climbing moves pass that, and then it's a horizontally inclined ridge walk to the anchor.
content.location:
On the uphill/north side of Split Rock. Look for said Bulbosity on your right as you stroll east up the main trail.

Rap off the west side (climber's right) when done.
